intro: Sida orbiculata, commonly known as roundleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its orbicular (rounded) leaves and small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Sida orbiculata is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
